articles.description: Former Louisiana-Lafayette OL O'Cyrus Torrence, who was an All-Sun Belt selection the last two years, will be reunited with Gators coach Billy Napier after committing to transferring to Florida.
articles.headline: Former Louisiana-Lafayette offensive lineman O'Cyrus Torrence to transfer to Florida Gators

images.name: cfp trophy [608x342] - Copy
images.caption: A proposal to expand the College Football Playoff has hit repeated roadblocks.

images.name: 210721 acc phillips photo [608x342]
images.caption: ACC commissioner Jim Phillips believes that "now is not the right time to expand the College Football Playoff."

images.name: What's next for the path to CFP expansion?
images.caption: Greg McElroy and Heather Dinich discuss how the committee can eventually come to an agreement and approve a deal for CFP expansion.

articles.description: Seven months and nine in-person meetings after revealing the proposal that was initially applauded, those who created the CFP expansion plan and publicized it have been unable to implement it.

categories.description: topic for all college football playoff content

articles.headline: Inside the College Football Playoff expansion stalemate, and what comes next

images.name: Jahleel Billingsley reels in the final TD of his Bama career

articles.description: Jahleel Billingsley will reunite with Texas coach Steve Sarkisian, who was Alabama's offensive coordinator in 2020 when the tight end emerged as a playmaker.
articles.headline: Tight end Jahleel Billingsley transferring from Alabama Crimson Tide to Texas Longhorns

article.description: Robert Riddle threw for four touchdowns and Tyray Devezin ran for two more as Mercer got off to a fast start on its way to a 49-27 victory over Western Carolina in the season opener and initial Southern Conference encounter of the season on Saturday.
article.headline: Riddle throws for 4 TDs, Mercer rolls over W. Carolina 49-27
article.linkText: Riddle throws for 4 TDs, Mercer rolls over W. Carolina 49-27
article.story: CULLOWHEE, N.C. -- Robert Riddle threw for four touchdowns and Tyray Devezin ran for two more as Mercer got off to a fast start on its way to a 49-27 victory over Western Carolina in the season opener and initial Southern Conference encounter of the season on Saturday. David Durden returned the opening kickoff 82 yards and three plays later Riddle hit Devezin on a 12-yard scoring strike and the Bears were on their way to victory. On the next series, Riddle hit Durden for a 32-yard TD toss to go up 14-0. The Bears continued the onslaught in the second period as Riddle found Tucker Cannon for an 85-yard touchdown bomb, the second longest offensive play in school history. Deondre Johnson broke for a 64-yard scoring scamper on Mercer's next possession. Riddle threw for 190 yards and four scores in the first half. Western Carolina's Tyrie Adams, who threw for 360 yards, ran for 185 and scored four touchdowns in a 59-46 loss last year, threw for 318 yards and had 34 yards on the ground this year. He threw for two scores and added a rushing touchdown.
